data.event: The first settlers from the Paoay area in Ilocos Norte arrived in 1830, and founded the first Spanish settlement that developed into what is now San Antonio.
The first settlers from the Paoay area in Ilocos Norte arrived in 1830, and founded the first Spanish settlement that developed into what is now San Antonio.

event.title: was given the status of district or barrio in 1836

data.event: San Antonio was given the status of district or barrio in 1836.

event.title: was succeeded by Don Vicente Lacuesta in 1849

data.event: He was succeeded by Don Vicente Lacuesta in 1849, from Teniente Primero to Teniente Absoluto.

event.title: was succeeded by Don Dimas Pascasio as governor in 1856

data.event: He was succeeded by Don Dimas Pascasio as governor in 1856.
